case_vignette: A 58-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 4-day history of abdominal pain and vomiting. Initially, the vomitus was food that he had recently eaten, but it is now bilious. He has had similar complaints several times in the past 6 years. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 25 years and drinks 24 oz of alcohol daily. He is 160 cm (5 ft 3 in) tall and weighs 48 kg (105 lb); BMI is 19 kg/m2. His vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination shows an epigastric mass. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing abdominal pain and vomiting for the past 4 days.
Can you tell me if you have had any changes in your bowel habits?
No changes in my bowel habits have been mentioned.
Can you provide your age and sex?
I am a 58-year-old man.
Do you have any past medical history of gastrointestinal issues or other chronic conditions?
I have had similar complaints of abdominal pain and vomiting several times over the past 6 years.
Are you currently taking any medications for any chronic conditions? If so, could you please list them for me?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications.
Do you have a family history of gastrointestinal problems or any other significant medical conditions?
There's no family history of medical conditions provided.
**Final Diagnosis:** Recurrent Gastroenteritis
